author: Staff Reporter
text:
Apart from pets, stray dogs, cats, cattle on the roads and thousands of birds are also facing the brunt of the scorching heat. Animal welfare groups have urged people to provide water to animals on the streets.

People for Cattle in India (PFCI), as part of their Water Bowl Challenge of 2016, has asked people to place water bowls outside their homes.

“As of now, nearly 200 people have done so. People should ensure that the bowls are clean and not contaminated,” said Arun Prasanna of PFCI.

Blue Cross of India too has been distributing water bowls. Over 900 have been given away so far, said general manager Dawn Williams.

“A lot of people mistakenly believe they have to take water to birds and put bowls on rooftops. The water gets very hot on roofs and birds can’t bathe in it. Just place water bowls under a tree and change the water frequently,” he said.

Residents can also scatter grain for birds and keep leftover food for animals he said. “Monkeys may come too, but don’t pelt stones at them. They too are suffering in the heat,” he said.

Residents can call Blue Cross of India on 044-22354959 if they see an animal in distress.
title: Surviving on the streets
